about.title: About Us
about.history: The 6 Kilo Gibi Gubae was established in 1985 as a spiritual gathering for Ethiopian Orthodox Tewahedo Church students at Addis Ababa University. It has served as a spiritual haven and support system for thousands of students.
goals_list: Strengthen our relationship with God through daily prayer
Study and understand the teachings of the Ethiopian Orthodox Tewahedo Church
Support each other in faith, education, and life challenges
Preserve and celebrate our sacred traditions
about.tradition: Our tradition is deeply rooted in the practices of the Ethiopian Orthodox Tewahedo Church, including regular gatherings, fasting, and confession.

vision.title: Vision & Mission
vision.vision_statement: To create a vibrant spiritual community that nurtures the faith of Ethiopian Orthodox students during their university education.
vision.mission_statement: We are committed to supporting students in maintaining their spiritual practices, providing guidance, and creating a sense of belonging and community.

quotes.quote: Education without spiritual foundation is like a house built on sand.
quotes.author: St. Yared

quotes.quote: Let your learning strengthen your faith, and your faith guide your learning.
quotes.author: St. Tekle Haymanot

involvement.title: Student Involvement
involvement.participation: Students participate through regular attendance at services, joining prayer groups, and taking part in religious celebrations and traditions.
involvement.confession: Students are encouraged to maintain a relationship with their confession father for spiritual guidance and support.
involvement.advisors: Spiritual advisors are available to help students navigate their faith journey during their university education.
